John__04.1: When Jesus therefore understood that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus maketh more disciples, and baptizeth more than John,
John__04.2: (Though Jesus himself did not baptize, but his disciples,)
John__04.3: He left Judea, and went again into Galilee.
John__04.4: And he was of necessity to pass through Samaria.
John__04.5: He cometh therefore to a city of Samaria, which is called Sichar, near the land which Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
John__04.6: Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well. It was about the sixth hour.
John__04.7: There cometh a woman of Samaria, to draw water. Jesus saith to her: Give me to drink.
John__04.8: For his disciples were gone into the city to buy meats.
John__04.9: Then that Samaritan woman saith to him: How dost thou, being a Jew, ask of me to drink, who am a Samaritan woman? For the Jews do not communicate with the Samaritans.
John__04.10: Jesus answered, and said to her: If thou didst know the gift of God, and who he is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou perhaps wouldst have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
John__04.11: The woman saith to him: Sir, thou hast nothing wherein to draw, and the well is deep; from whence then hast thou living water?
John__04.12: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
John__04.13: Jesus answered, and said to her: Whosoever drinketh of this water, shall thirst again; but he that shall drink of the water that I will give him, shall not thirst for ever:
John__04.14: But the water that I will give him, shall become in him a fountain of water, springing up into life everlasting.
John__04.15: The woman saith to him: Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come hither to draw.
John__04.16: Jesus saith to her: Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
John__04.17: The woman answered, and said: I have no husband. Jesus said to her: Thou hast said well, I have no husband:
John__04.18: For thou hast had five husbands: and he whom thou now hast, is not thy husband. This thou hast said truly.
John__04.19: The woman saith to him: Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
John__04.20: Our fathers adored on <u>this mountain</u>, and you say, that at Jerusalem is the place where men must adore.
John__04.21: Jesus saith to her: Woman, believe me, that the hour cometh, when you shall neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, adore the Father.
John__04.22: You adore that which you know not: we adore that which we know; for salvation is of the Jews.
John__04.23: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true adorers shall adore the Father in spirit and in truth. For the Father also seeketh such to adore him.
John__04.24: God is a spirit; and they that adore him, must adore him in spirit and in truth.
John__04.25: The woman saith to him: I know that the Messias cometh (who is called Christ). Therefore, when he is come, he will tell us all things.
John__04.26: Jesus saith to her: I am he, who am speaking with thee.
John__04.27: And immediately his disciples came; and they wondered that he talked with the woman. Yet no man said: What seekest thou? or, why talkest thou with her?
John__04.28: The woman therefore left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men there:
John__04.29: Come, and see a man who has told me all things whatsoever I have done. Is not he the Christ?
John__04.30: They went therefore out of the city, and came unto him.
John__04.31: In the mean time the disciples prayed him, saying: Rabbi, eat.
John__04.32: But he said to them: I have meat to eat, which you know not.
John__04.33: The disciples therefore said one to another: Hath any man brought him to eat?
John__04.34: Jesus saith to them: My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, that I may perfect his work.
John__04.35: Do you not say, There are yet four months, and then the harvest cometh? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes, and see the countries; for they are white already to harvest.
John__04.36: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life everlasting: that both he that soweth, and he that reapeth, may rejoice together.
John__04.37: For in this is the saying true: That it is one man that soweth, and it is another that reapeth.
John__04.38: I have sent you to reap that in which you did not labour: others have laboured, and you have entered into their labours.
John__04.39: Now of that city many of the Samaritans believed in him, for the word of the woman giving testimony: He told me all things whatsoever I have done.
John__04.40: So when the Samaritans were come to him, they desired that he would tarry there. And he abode there two days.
John__04.41: And many more believed in him because of his own word.
John__04.42: And they said to the woman: We now believe, not for thy saying: for we ourselves have heard him, and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.
John__04.43: Now after two days, he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
John__04.44: For Jesus himself gave testimony that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
John__04.45: And when he was come into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things he had done at Jerusalem on the festival day; for they also went to the festival day.
John__04.46: He came again therefore into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain ruler, whose son was sick at Capharnaum.
John__04.47: He having heard that Jesus was come from Judea into Galilee, went to him, and prayed him to come down, and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
John__04.48: Jesus therefore said to him: Unless you see signs and wonders, you believe not.
John__04.49: The ruler saith to him: Lord, come down before that my son die.
John__04.50: Jesus saith to him: Go thy way; thy son liveth. The man believed the word which Jesus said to him, and went his way.
John__04.51: And as he was going down, his servants met him; and they brought word, saying, that his son lived.
John__04.52: He asked therefore of them the hour wherein he grew better. And they said to him: Yesterday, at the seventh hour, the fever left him.
John__04.53: The father therefore knew, that it was at the same hour that Jesus said to him, Thy son liveth; and himself believed, and his whole house.
John__04.54: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judea into Galilee.
